title: Under the hood of github-readme-stats project
content:
## Intro
Recently I came across this "special" picture in someone's Readme profile on Github, displaying profile stats, and it caught my curiosity. Yes, I am talking about this `github-readme-stats` widget, here is an example for my profile. 

![Example of the image for my profile (it is "dynamic" here as well)](https://github-readme-stats.vercel.app/api?username=Bogdan-Lyashenko&show_icons=true&hide=contribs)

> It is "dynamic", meaning, every time you see this image it is going to be up to date with the current stats. 

How it renders dynamic information inside of the static markdown page? Looks cool though, so I started digging - inspected source and quickly found out there is app running at [github-readme-stats.vercel.app](https://github-readme-stats.vercel.app/) so can be used by anyone, and it is an open source project [github-readme-stats](https://github.com/anuraghazra/github-readme-stats). Awesome, let's look under the hood then.
